definition: to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat
to be indebted to sb for care/thank you for looking after me

sentences.english: All you have accomplished, honourable teacher, for my backward daughter!
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的老师，小女浅陋无知，承蒙您教诲。

sentences.english: We were graced with the presence of our chairman.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙主席光临，不胜荣幸。

sentences.english: I’m very grateful to you for your kind invitation, and I’m sure to come to see your concert.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙邀请观看你们的音乐会，我一定按时到场。

sentences.english: Please remember the sign of the Minlongda brand, and be ware of imitations .
sentences.chinese: 承蒙惠顾，请认准闽龙达商标标志，谨防假冒。

sentences.english: I owe to such evenings the idea I have of innocence.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙这些夜晚，我才有了纯真的念想。

sentences.english: Many thanks for a copy of "The Chinese-English Dictionary".
sentences.chinese: 承蒙惠赠＜汉英词典＞，甚为感谢。

sentences.english: Thank you in advance for your consideration and  courtesy.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙阁下的关怀和礼遇，至此表示感谢。

sentences.english: By courtesy of the mourner he endeavours to devour the nourishing odour.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙哀悼者同意，他努力吞坛滋养气味。

sentences.english: We are grateful to you for gracing out dinner with your presence.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙您光临我们的晚宴，我们深表感谢。

sentences.english: I am very flattered by your invitation to talk at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙你邀我在会上讲话，深感荣幸。

sentences.english: It is generous of you to take so much interest in my work.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙你对我的工作如此操心。

sentences.english: Thank you for your purchase of Philips Juice Extractor.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙购买飞利浦型榨汁机。

sentences.english: By courtesy of the mourner, he endeavours to devour the nourishing odour.
sentences.chinese: 承蒙哀悼者同意，他努力吞食滋养气味。

definition: lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
truth to tell/to be quite honest...
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
